intro: Sisymbrium gamosepalum, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as fields and roadsides. The plant has a long flowering period, usually from late spring to early autumn.
